page.title: 02EDUCATION IN COLYTON
page.content: There is a County Primary school in Colyton with a Headmaster who teaches, 3 full time teachers and one part time teacher. There are about 80 children between the ages of 5 and 11. The school has a swimming pool. In their last year at primary school, the children take an exam to decide whether they should go on to the Grammar School in Colyford or the secondary school at Axminster. The Grammar School was founded by the Feoffees (see page 7) in the sixteenth century and used to meet in a building near Colyton Church until 1927. There have been discussions about reorganising the secondary schools for Colyton children into a comprehensive system. Some children travel out of the area to other schools at Sidmouth or to a number of private schools.
